member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Mobile.Service.ClearDatabaseSchemaAlways`1
member.summary: An implementation of that will DELETE all resources (e.g. tables, views, functions, and procedures) within a given database schema and re-seed the database regardless of whether the database model has changed. This implementation of is useful if the current user only has permission to access resources within a particular database schema and not the entire database.
member.remarks: To seed the database create a derived class and override the Seed method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Mobile.Service.ClearDatabaseSchemaAlways`1.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the that will DELETE all resources from the default schema derived from the service name regardless of whether the model has changed.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a given .
member.param: The schema to DELETE all resources from regardless of whether the model has changed.

member.summary: DELETE all resources from the .

member.summary: Gets the schema to DELETE all resources from.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Mobile.Service.ClearDatabaseSchemaIfModelChanges`1
member.summary: An implementation of that will DELETE all resources (e.g. tables, views, functions, and procedures) within a given database schema, and optionally re-seed the database only if the model has changed since the database was created. This implementation of is useful if the current user only has permission to access resources within a particular database schema and not the entire database.
member.remarks: Whether or not the model has changed is determined by the method. To seed the database create a derived class and override the Seed method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Mobile.Service.ClearDatabaseSchemaIfModelChanges`1.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the that will DELETE all resources from the default schema derived from the service name in case the model has changed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Mobile.Service.ClearDatabaseSchemaIfModelChanges`1.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a given .
member.param: The schema to DELETE all resources from in case the model has changed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Mobile.Service.MappedEntityDomainManager`2
member.summary: Provides an implementation targeting SQL as the backend store using Entity Framework where there is not a 1:1 mapping between the data object (DTO) exposed through a and the domain model managed by SQL. See for situations where there is a 1:1 relationship between the Data Object (DTO) and the domain model managed by SQL.
member.remarks: The leverages AutoMapper to map between the DTO and the domain model and it is assumed that AutoMapper has already been initialized with appropriate mappings that map from DTO => domain model and from domain model => DTO. The bi-directional mapping is required for both reads (GET, QUERY) and updates (PUT, POST, DELETE, PATCH) to function.
member.typeparam: The type of the domain data model

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Mobile.Service.MappedEntityDomainManager`2.GetOriginalValue(System.Data.Entity.Infrastructure.DbUpdateConcurrencyException)
member.summary: Gets the original value of an entity in case an update or replace operation resulted in an . The original value extracted from the exception will get returned to the client so that it can merge the data and possibly try the operation again.
member.param: The thrown by the update or replace operation.
member.returns: The original value or null if none are available.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Mobile.Service.MappedEntityDomainManager`2.SetOriginalVersion(`1,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Override this method to support optimistic concurrent updates and replace operations. In order to evaluate whether an object has been updated concurrently, Entity Framework needs to know the original version of the object being edited and compare that to the current version maintained in the database. This requires that the original value is known by Entity Framework so that it can ask the database to do the check.
member.remarks:
In case the column used to manage versioning is called "Version", the code to set the original value looks like this:
this.context.Entry(model).OriginalValues["Version"] = version;
member.param: The original version provided by the request as being the version that is being updated; or null if no version was indicated.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Mobile.Service.MappedEntityDomainManager`2.VerifyUpdatedKey(System.String,`0)
member.summary: Verify that the id specified in the request URI matches that of an updated entity. If not then throw an exception as ids can't be modified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Mobile.Service.EntityContext.Schema
member.summary: Gets or sets the default database schema name. This default database schema name is used for database objects that do not have an explicitly configured schema name. If the schema name is null or empty then a default schema name is derived from the service name.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Mobile.Service.EntityData
member.summary: An abstract implementation of the interface indicating how the system properties for a given table data model are to be serialized when communicating with clients when using Entity Framework for accessing the backend store. The uniform serialization of system properties ensures that the clients can process the system properties uniformly across platforms. Concrete entity framework models can derive from this base class in order to support the system properties.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Mobile.Service.Tables.EntityTableSqlGenerator
member.summary: Updates the SQL DB definition to take into account columns marked by . The can be enabled either by using the scaffolded or by deriving from the base class.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Mobile.Service.EntityDomainManager`1
member.summary: Provides a implementation targeting SQL as the backend store using Entity Framework. In this model, there is a 1:1 mapping between the data object (DTO) exposed through a and the domain model. The is the recommended for situations where there is not a 1:1 relationship between the Data Object (DTO) and the domain model managed by SQL.
